title: Boran
summary: Boran (also spelled Buran, Middle Persian: ; New Persian: پوران‌دخت, Pūrāndokht) was Sasanian queen (or banbishn) of Persia from 630 to 632, with an interruption of some months. She was the daughter of king (or shah) Khosrow II (r. 590–628) and the Byzantine princess Maria. She is the second of only three women to rule in Iranian history, the others being Musa of Parthia, and Boran's sister Azarmidokht.
